titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of a Borrower's Card: D. S. S. Mackenzie

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Transcribed cards s1: "balance due" = all crossed out, # is unreadable Sept 23 = "Maudva"? "Mandva"? Oct 3 = "Faust"? s2: Nov 23 = "son"? "soo"? s4: Feb 17 = crossed out too much, return date illegible Feb 27 = return date crossed out Feb 13 = "Trent"? s5: May 15 = "Flotz"? s7: address = "Azaln"? illegible notation next to address

div.note: 2 vol 6 m a 180v Paid 50v Sept 19 - Balance due v deposit 100v ref May 22 100v redeposited May 24

bibl.title: The mystery of the blue train

div.note: has 2 wks left from Oct 13 1939 to Oct 30th ..
(took sent p.c. to hotel Nov 14 Nov 19
Nov 21 1939 refunded deposit 100 less subscription 20 80 to Miss Trevor S.B.
Daphne Trevor subscription expired Oct 30 1939 books returned Nov 21 1939 by Miss Trevor subscription 20 days 20 (paid out of deposit) Nov 21 2 new books for 21 days at 2v each 84 SB only took 20
Miss Trevor had balance due: 64 refunded to Mr. M. his 100v and seemed upset
